subject: Philosophy
title: Existentialism in Literature
description: A short lesson to help you apply Existentialism in Literature.

hook.text: Kafka's Gregor Samsa wakes up as a giant insect. Nobody questions why. They just adapt.

buildup.text: Existentialist literature doesn't explain the world. It presents its strangeness without resolution.

discovery.text: Kafka, Camus, Sartre, and Beckett wrote stories where meaning collapses and characters must respond.

twist.text: These aren't escape fiction. They're mirrors â€” showing readers their own absurd daily existence.

climax.text: Existentialist novels changed how we read. Characters no longer need a quest â€” just awareness.

punchline.text: The best existentialist stories have no answers. Just questions.

quiz.question: What distinguishes existentialist literature?
options: It presents absurdity and meaninglessness without resolution
